Package com.gemalto.idp.mobile.oob.message

Interface OobMessageManager

public interface OobMessageManager
This manager provides way to create outgoing messages for the server and send/fetch messages to/from the server.
Since:
4.0

  • Method Details

    • createUserToProviderMessage

      OobUserToProviderMessage createUserToProviderMessage(String locale, Date createTime, SecureString subject, String from, String to, String replyTo, String threadId, String contentType, SecureByteArray content, OobUserMessageAttachment[] attachments, Map<String,String> meta)
      Creates an user message.
      Parameters:
      locale - Locale to use to handle messages.
      createTime - Message creation time. The value cannot be null.
      subject - Message subject.
      from - Message originator. Can be null.
      to - Message recipient.
      replyTo - Message recipient to use in case a response is send by the server. Can be null
      threadId - Message thread identifier.
      contentType - Message content-type.
      content - Message content.
      attachments - Array of attachments to the message. Can be null.
      meta - Meta data for the message. Can be null.
      Returns:
      The user message ready to be sent.

    • createUserMessageAttachment

      OobUserMessageAttachment createUserMessageAttachment(SecureString subject, String contentType, SecureByteArray content, Map<String,String> meta)
      Creates a user message attachment.
      Parameters:
      subject - Message subject.
      contentType - Message content-type.
      content - Message content.
      meta - Meta data for the message. Can be null.
      Returns:
      The user message attachment ready to be sent.

    • createGenericOutgoingMessage

      OobGenericOutgoingMessage createGenericOutgoingMessage(String contentType, SecureByteArray content)
      Creates a generic message.
      Parameters:
      contentType - Message content-type.
      content - Message content.
      Returns:
      The generic message ready to be sent.

    • createOobError

      OobErrorMessage createOobError(int errorCode, String errorDescription, String errorStackTrace, String externalRef, Map<String,String> meta)
      Creates an error message.
      Parameters:
      errorCode - Error code.
      errorDescription - Error description.
      errorStackTrace - Error stack trace. Can be null.
      externalRef - Any external reference. Can be null.
      meta - Meta data for the message. Can be null.
      Returns:
      The error message ready to be sent.

    • createOobError

      OobErrorMessage createOobError(int errorCode, String errorDescription, Exception exception, String externalRef, Map<String,String> meta)
      Creates an error message.
      Parameters:
      errorCode - Error code.
      errorDescription - Error description.
      exception - Exception to be sent. Can be null.
      externalRef - Any external reference. Can be null.
      meta - Meta data for the message. Can be null.
      Returns:
      The error message ready to be sent.

    • fetchMessage

      OobFetchMessageResponse fetchMessage(int timeout)
      Fetches a message from the server: the synchronous variant.

      This method fetches the first message from server queue.

      Attention:
      This method blocks the calling thread potentially for a very long time (like tens of seconds or even more, depending on the quality of the mobile network connection).

      When this method is called from within the main UI thread it throws the NetworkOnMainThreadException - as it is very bad habit to obstacle the main UI thread with the blocking calls (the same is done for instance by the Android HTTP library).

      Parameters:
      timeout - Maximum time in second to wait for an incoming message.
      Returns:
      The response object containing the incoming OOB message if any.

    • fetchMessage

      OobFetchMessageResponse fetchMessage(int timeout, OobRequestParameter requestParameter)
      Fetches a message from the server: the synchronous variant.

      This method fetches the first message from server queue.

      Attention:
      This method blocks the calling thread potentially for a very long time (like tens of seconds or even more, depending on the quality of the mobile network connection).

      When this method is called from within the main UI thread it throws the NetworkOnMainThreadException - as it is very bad habit to obstacle the main UI thread with the blocking calls (the same is done for instance by the Android HTTP library).

      Parameters:
      timeout - Maximum time in second to wait for an incoming message.
      requestParameter - The request object containing custom headers.
      Returns:
      The response object containing the incoming OOB message if any.
      Since:
      4.7

    • fetchMessage

      OobFetchMessageResponse fetchMessage(String messageId)
      Fetches a message from the server: the synchronous variant.

      This method fetches a message with a specific identifier.

      Attention:
      This method blocks the calling thread potentially for a very long time (like tens of seconds or even more, depending on the quality of the mobile network connection).

      When this method is called from within the main UI thread it throws the NetworkOnMainThreadException - as it is very bad habit to obstacle the main UI thread with the blocking calls (the same is done for instance by the Android HTTP library).

      Parameters:
      messageId - Identifier of the message to fetch.
      Returns:
      The response object containing the incoming OOB message if any.

    • fetchMessage

      OobFetchMessageResponse fetchMessage(String messageId, OobRequestParameter requestParameter)
      Fetches a message from the server: the synchronous variant.

      This method fetches a message with a specific identifier.

      Attention:
      This method blocks the calling thread potentially for a very long time (like tens of seconds or even more, depending on the quality of the mobile network connection).

      When this method is called from within the main UI thread it throws the NetworkOnMainThreadException - as it is very bad habit to obstacle the main UI thread with the blocking calls (the same is done for instance by the Android HTTP library).

      Parameters:
      messageId - Identifier of the message to fetch.
      requestParameter - The request object containing custom headers.
      Returns:
      The response object containing the incoming OOB message if any.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - When the collection of headers passed in is null, or adding a header prohibited in the headers customization or containing illegal characters.
      Since:
      4.7

    • sendMessage

      OobMessageResponse sendMessage(OobOutgoingMessage message)
      Sends a message to the server: the synchronous variant.
      Attention:
      This method blocks the calling thread potentially for a very long time (like tens of seconds or even more, depending on the quality of the mobile network connection).

      When this method is called from within the main UI thread it throws the NetworkOnMainThreadException - as it is very bad habit to obstacle the main UI thread with the blocking calls (the same is done for instance by the Android HTTP library).

      Parameters:
      message - The object that will be use to post the result to the UI thread.
      Returns:
      The OOB send status.

    • sendMessage

      OobMessageResponse sendMessage(OobOutgoingMessage message, OobRequestParameter oobRequestParameter)
      Sends a message to the server: the synchronous variant.

      Attention:
      This method blocks the calling thread potentially for a very long time (like tens of seconds or even more, depending on the quality of the mobile network connection).

      When this method is called from within the main UI thread it throws the NetworkOnMainThreadException - as it is very bad habit to obstacle the main UI thread with the blocking calls (the same is done for instance by the Android HTTP library).

      Parameters:
      message - The object that will be use to post the result to the UI thread.
      oobRequestParameter - The request object containing custom header.
      Returns:
      The OOB send status.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - When the collection of headers passed in is null, or adding a header prohibited in the headers customization or containing illegal characters.
      Since:
      4.7

    • acknowledgeMessage

      OobResponse acknowledgeMessage(OobIncomingMessage message)
      Sends a message acknowledgment to the server: the synchronous variant.
      Attention:
      This method blocks the calling thread potentially for a very long time (like tens of seconds or even more, depending on the quality of the mobile network connection).

      When this method is called from within the main UI thread it throws the NetworkOnMainThreadException - as it is very bad habit to obstacle the main UI thread with the blocking calls (the same is done for instance by the Android HTTP library).

      Parameters:
      message - The incoming message to acknowledge.
      Returns:
      The OOB acknowledgment response object carrying the result of the operation.

    • acknowledgeMessage

      OobResponse acknowledgeMessage(OobIncomingMessage message, OobRequestParameter oobRequestParameter)
      Sends a message acknowledgment to the server: the synchronous variant.

      Attention:
      This method blocks the calling thread potentially for a very long time (like tens of seconds or even more, depending on the quality of the mobile network connection).

      When this method is called from within the main UI thread it throws the NetworkOnMainThreadException - as it is very bad habit to obstacle the main UI thread with the blocking calls (the same is done for instance by the Android HTTP library).

      Parameters:
      message - The incoming message to acknowledge.
      oobRequestParameter - The request object carrying custom header.
      Returns:
      The OOB acknowledgment response object carrying the result of the operation.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - When the collection of headers passed in is null, or adding a header prohibited in the headers customization or containing illegal characters.
      Since:
      4.7

    • fetchMessage

      void fetchMessage(int timeout, OobFetchMessageCallback callback)
      Fetches a message from the server: the asynchronous variant.

      This method fetches the first message from server queue.

      This method is executed asynchronously and the result will be posted in the provided callback interface. The callback will be done in the UI thread.

      Parameters:
      timeout - Maximum time in second to wait for an incoming message.
      callback - The object that will be use to post the result to the UI thread.

    • fetchMessage

      void fetchMessage(int timeout, OobFetchMessageCallback callback, OobRequestParameter oobRequestParameter)
      Fetches a message from the server: the asynchronous variant.

      This method fetches the first message from server queue.

      This method is executed asynchronously and the result will be posted in the provided callback interface. The callback will be done in the UI thread.

      Parameters:
      timeout - Maximum time in second to wait for an incoming message.
      callback - The object that will be use to post the result to the UI thread.
      oobRequestParameter - The request parameter containing custom header.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - When the collection of headers passed in is null, or adding a header prohibited in the headers customization or containing illegal characters.
      Since:
      4.7

    • fetchMessage

      void fetchMessage(String messageId, OobFetchMessageCallback callback)
      Fetches a message from the server: the asynchronous variant.

      This method fetches a message with a specific identifier.

      This method is executed asynchronously and the result will be posted in the provided callback interface. The callback will be done in the UI thread.

      Parameters:
      messageId - Identifier of the message to fetch.
      callback - The object that will be use to post the result to the UI thread.

    • fetchMessage

      void fetchMessage(String messageId, OobFetchMessageCallback callback, OobRequestParameter oobRequestParameter)
      Fetches a message from the server: the asynchronous variant.

      This method fetches the first message from server queue.

      This method is executed asynchronously and the result will be posted in the provided callback interface. The callback will be done in the UI thread.

      Parameters:
      messageId - Identifier of the message to fetch.
      callback - The object that will be use to post the result to the UI thread.
      oobRequestParameter - The request parameter containing custom header.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - When the collection of headers passed in is null, or adding a header prohibited in the headers customization or containing illegal characters.
      Since:
      4.7

    • sendMessage

      void sendMessage(OobOutgoingMessage message, OobSendMessageCallback callback)
      Sends a message to the server: the asynchronous variant.

      This method is executed asynchronously and the result will be posted in the provided callback interface. The callback will be done in the UI thread.

      Parameters:
      message - The message to send.
      callback - The object that will be use to post the result to the UI thread.

    • sendMessage

      void sendMessage(OobOutgoingMessage message, OobSendMessageCallback callback, OobRequestParameter oobRequestParameter)
      Sends a message to the server: the asynchronous variant.

      This method is executed asynchronously and the result will be posted in the provided callback interface. The callback will be done in the UI thread.

      Parameters:
      message - The message to send.
      callback -
      oobRequestParameter - The request parameter containing the custom header. The object that will be use to post the result to the UI thread.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - When the collection of headers passed in is null, or adding a header prohibited in the headers customization or containing illegal characters.
      Since:
      4.7

      Sends a message acknowledgment to the server: the asynchronous variant.

      This method is executed asynchronously and the result will be posted in the provided callback interface. The callback will be done in the UI thread.

      Parameters:
      message - The incoming message to acknowledge.
      callback - The object that will be use to post the result to the UI thread.

    • acknowledgeMessage
